title: HOW DO I LOCATE AN ATTORNEY WILLING TO GIVE A LEGAL APPRENTICESHIP TO SOME ONE WHO IS VERY INTERESTED IN PRACTICING LAW
question: I'M very interested in a legal apprenticeship in California I can't afford law school I'm a single father and can't qualify for any student loans I'm very eager to learn (Reading the law)
answers:
I had the same problem so I studied law at a correspondence law school. It takes at least 4 years to get your JD and another year or so to pass the bar.
For me it was studying on and off and I also at some point switched to another school, so from the day I started until I passed the bar it took more than 10 years. And all this time I was working full time.
I would strongly recommend:
http://www.universityofhonoluluschooloflaw.net/
University of Honolulu School of Law in Modesto California
They charge only $3,000 / year + books.
I sat for the bar exam last year, and it felt so good knowing that I owe NOTHING in student loans while most of the people sitting around me are in debts of over $200,000

This may not be the correct forum for your inquiry, sir. Generally speaking, I think attorneys seek to hire and/or mentor folks with in law school or already having a legal education as a secretary and/or a para-legal/clerk.
